cards.name: Spirit Weaver
cards.text: {2}: Target green or blue creature gets +0/+1 until end of turn.
cards.flavor: "Let my hope be your shield."
cards.originalText: {2}: Target green or blue creature gets +0/+1 until end of turn.

cards.name: Strength of Unity
cards.text:
Enchant creature
Domain — Enchanted creature gets +1/+1 for each basic land type among lands you control.
cards.flavor: All Dominarians agreed on one thing: they would not go down without a fight.

rulings.text: To determine the number of basic land types among lands you control, look at the lands you have on the battlefield and ask yourself whether the subtypes Plains, Island, Swamp, Mountain, and Forest appear within that group. The number of times you say yes (topping out at five) tells you how powerful your domain abilities will be.

How many lands you control of a particular basic land type is irrelevant to a domain ability, as long as that number is greater than zero. As far as domain is concerned, ten Forests is the same as one Forest.

A number of nonbasic lands have basic land types. Domain abilities don't count the number of lands you control — they count the number of basic land types among lands you control, even if that means checking the same land twice. For example, if you control a Tundra, an Overgrown Tomb, and a Madblind Mountain, you'll have a Plains, Island, Swamp, Mountain, and Forest among the lands you control. Your domain abilities will be maxed out.

cards.originalText: Enchanted creature gets +1/+1 for each basic land type among lands you control.

cards.name: Sunscape Apprentice
cards.text:
{G}, {T}: Target creature gets +1/+1 until end of turn.
{U}, {T}: Put target creature you control on top of its owner's library.
cards.originalText:
{G}, {T}: Target creature gets +1/+1 until end of turn.
{U}, {T}: Put target creature you control on top of its owner's library.

cards.name: Sunscape Master
cards.text:
{G}{G}, {T}: Creatures you control get +2/+2 until end of turn.
{U}{U}, {T}: Return target creature to its owner's hand.

rulings.text: The first ability only affects creatures you control at the time the ability resolves.

cards.originalText:
{G}{G}, {T}: Creatures you control get +2/+2 until end of turn.
{U}{U}, {T}: Return target creature to its owner's hand.

{W}, Sacrifice an enchantment: Destroy target enchantment.

"If I do nothing else, I will protect my people."
—Teferi
cards.originalText:
{W}, Sacrifice an enchantment: Destroy target enchantment.
{3}{U}{U}: Counter target enchantment spell.

cards.name: Wayfaring Giant
cards.text: Domain — Wayfaring Giant gets +1/+1 for each basic land type among lands you control.
cards.flavor: Its stature and stride increase with each step it takes.

rulings.text: To determine the number of basic land types among lands you control, look at the lands you have on the battlefield and ask yourself whether the subtypes Plains, Island, Swamp, Mountain, and Forest appear within that group. The number of times you say yes (topping out at five) tells you how powerful your domain abilities will be.

How many lands you control of a particular basic land type is irrelevant to a domain ability, as long as that number is greater than zero. As far as domain is concerned, ten Forests is the same as one Forest.

A number of nonbasic lands have basic land types. Domain abilities don't count the number of lands you control — they count the number of basic land types among lands you control, even if that means checking the same land twice. For example, if you control a Tundra, an Overgrown Tomb, and a Madblind Mountain, you'll have a Plains, Island, Swamp, Mountain, and Forest among the lands you control. Your domain abilities will be maxed out.

cards.originalText: Wayfaring Giant gets +1/+1 for each basic land type among lands you control.

cards.name: Winnow
cards.text:
Destroy target nonland permanent if another permanent with the same name is on the battlefield.
Draw a card.
cards.flavor:
"Strength in numbers? I think not."
—Gerrard
cards.originalText:
Destroy target nonland permanent if another permanent with the same name is in play.
Draw a card.

cards.name: Barrin's Unmaking
cards.text: Return target permanent to its owner's hand if that permanent shares a color with the most common color among all permanents or a color tied for most common.
cards.originalText: Return target permanent to its owner's hand if that permanent shares a color with the most common color among all permanents or the color tied for most common.

cards.name: Blind Seer
cards.text: {1}{U}: Target spell or permanent becomes the color of your choice until end of turn.
cards.flavor:
"I think he sees more than he lets on."
—Gerrard

rulings.text: If you change the color of a spell which is to become a permanent, the permanent will retain the color change until the end of the turn.

cards.originalText: {1}{U}: Target spell or permanent becomes the color of your choice until end of turn.

cards.name: Breaking Wave
cards.text:
You may cast Breaking Wave as though it had flash if you pay {2} more to cast it. (You may cast it any time you could cast an instant.)
Simultaneously untap all tapped creatures and tap all untapped creatures.
cards.originalText:
You may play Breaking Wave any time you could play an instant if you pay {2} more to play it.
Simultaneously untap all tapped creatures and tap all untapped creatures.

cards.name: Collective Restraint
cards.text: Domain — Creatures can't attack you unless their controller pays {X} for each creature they control that's attacking you, where X is the number of basic land types among lands you control.

rulings.text: In the Two-Headed Giant format, you still only have to pay once per creature.

To determine the number of basic land types among lands you control, look at the lands you have on the battlefield and ask yourself whether the subtypes Plains, Island, Swamp, Mountain, and Forest appear within that group. The number of times you say yes (topping out at five) tells you how powerful your domain abilities will be.

How many lands you control of a particular basic land type is irrelevant to a domain ability, as long as that number is greater than zero. As far as domain is concerned, ten Forests is the same as one Forest.

A number of nonbasic lands have basic land types. Domain abilities don't count the number of lands you control — they count the number of basic land types among lands you control, even if that means checking the same land twice. For example, if you control a Tundra, an Overgrown Tomb, and a Madblind Mountain, you'll have a Plains, Island, Swamp, Mountain, and Forest among the lands you control. Your domain abilities will be maxed out.
Unless some effect explicitly says otherwise, a creature that can't attack you can still attack a planeswalker you control.

cards.originalText: Creatures can't attack you unless their controller pays {X} for each creature attacking you, where X is the number of basic land types among lands you control. (This cost is paid as attackers are declared.)

cards.name: Crystal Spray
cards.text:
Change the text of target spell or permanent by replacing all instances of one color word with another or one basic land type with another until end of turn.
Draw a card.

rulings.text: Alters all occurrences of the chosen word in the text box and the type line of the given card.
Can target a card with no appropriate words on it, or even one with no words at all.
It can't change a word to the same word. It must be a different word.
It only changes what is printed on the card (or set on a token when it was created or set by a copy effect). It will not change any effects that are on the permanent.
You choose the words to change on resolution.
You can't change proper nouns (i.e. card names) such as "Island Fish Jasconius".

Changing the text of a spell will not allow you to change the targets of the spell because the targets were chosen when the spell was cast. The text change will (probably) cause it to be countered since the targets will be illegal.
If you change the text of a spell which is to become a permanent, the permanent will retain the text change until the effect wears off.
It can be used to change a land's type from one basic land type to another. For example, Forest can be changed to Island so it produces blue mana. It doesn't change the name of any permanent.

cards.originalText:
Change the text of target spell or permanent by replacing all instances of one color word or basic land type with another until end of turn.
Draw a card.

cards.name: Disrupt
cards.text:
Counter target instant or sorcery spell unless its controller pays {1}.
Draw a card.
cards.flavor: Teferi wanted no part of Urza's battle plans, but both agreed the Phyrexian portal must be closed.

rulings.text: You draw a card regardless of whether the targeted spell was countered or {1} was paid.

cards.originalText:
Counter target instant or sorcery spell unless its controller pays {1}.
Draw a card.

cards.name: Distorting Wake
cards.text: Return X target nonland permanents to their owners' hands.
cards.flavor: Gerrard savored a grim smile as the Phyrexian portals disappeared behind the Weatherlight.
cards.originalText: Return X target nonland permanents to their owners' hands.

cards.name: Dream Thrush
cards.text:
Flying
{T}: Target land becomes the basic land type of your choice until end of turn.
cards.flavor: Whether for good or ill, their arrival always means change.
cards.originalText:
Flying
{T}: Target land becomes a land of the basic land type of your choice until end of turn.

cards.name: Empress Galina
cards.text: {U}{U}, {T}: Gain control of target legendary permanent. (This effect lasts indefinitely.)
cards.flavor: "Above the waves you may be mighty indeed, but down here you belong to me."
cards.originalText: {U}{U}, {T}: Gain control of target Legend or legendary permanent. (This effect doesn't end at end of turn.)

cards.name: Essence Leak
cards.text:
Enchant permanent
As long as enchanted permanent is red or green, it has "At the beginning of your upkeep, sacrifice this permanent unless you pay its mana cost."
cards.flavor:
"We define the boundaries of reality; they don't define us."
—Teferi

rulings.text: It can enchant a permanent that is not red or green, but it doesn't do anything in that case.

cards.originalText: If enchanted permanent is red or green, it has "At the beginning of your upkeep, sacrifice this permanent unless you pay its mana cost."

cards.name: Exclude
cards.text:
Counter target creature spell.
Draw a card.
cards.flavor:
"I don't have time for you right now."
—Teferi

rulings.text: Exclude can target a creature spell that can't be countered. When Exclude resolves, that spell won't be countered, but you'll still draw a card.

cards.originalText:
Counter target creature spell.
Draw a card.

cards.name: Fact or Fiction
cards.text: Reveal the top five cards of your library. An opponent separates those cards into two piles. Put one pile into your hand and the other into your graveyard.

rulings.text: You choose which pile to put into your hand.
Each pile may contain from zero to five cards; they don't have to be split "evenly."

cards.originalText: Reveal the top five cards of your library. An opponent separates those cards into two face-up piles. Put one pile into your hand and the other into your graveyard.

cards.name: Faerie Squadron
cards.text:
Kicker {3}{U} (You may pay an additional {3}{U} as you cast this spell.)
If Faerie Squadron was kicked, it enters the battlefield with two +1/+1 counters on it and with flying.
cards.originalText:
Kicker {3}{U} (You may pay an additional {3}{U} as you play this spell.)
If you paid the kicker cost, Faerie Squadron comes into play with two +1/+1 counters on it and has flying.

cards.name: Mana Maze
cards.text: Players can't cast spells that share a color with the spell most recently cast this turn.
cards.flavor:
"Those who know only one path to victory can never hope to triumph."
—The Blind Seer

rulings.text: Does not affect the first spell cast each turn.
If a spell's color was changed while on the stack, use the color at the time it was when you started announcement, not as it currently is on the stack or as it was at the time it resolved.

cards.originalText: Players can't play spells that share a color with the spell last played this turn.

cards.name: Manipulate Fate
cards.text:
Search your library for three cards, exile them, then shuffle your library.
Draw a card.
cards.originalText:
Search your library for three cards, remove them from the game, then shuffle your library.
Draw a card.

cards.name: Metathran Aerostat
cards.text:
Flying
{X}{U}: You may put a creature card with converted mana cost X from your hand onto the battlefield. If you do, return Metathran Aerostat to its owner's hand.

rulings.text: You can activate the ability in response to itself and get more than one creature card onto the battlefield before this returns to its owner's hand.

cards.originalText:
Flying
{X}{U}: You may put a creature card with converted mana cost X from your hand into play. If you do, return Metathran Aerostat to its owner's hand.

cards.text:
Scry 1. (Look at the top card of your library. You may put that card on the bottom of your library.)
Draw a card.
cards.flavor: "We need alternatives, Hanna," yelled Gerrard. "Now"
cards.originalText:
Look at the top card of your library. You may put that card on the bottom of your library.
Draw a card.

cards.name: Phantasmal Terrain
cards.text:
Enchant land
As Phantasmal Terrain enters the battlefield, choose a basic land type.
Enchanted land is the chosen type.

rulings.text: Will not add or remove Snow Supertype to or from a land.

cards.originalText:
As Phantasmal Terrain comes into play, choose a basic land type.
Enchanted land is a land of the chosen type.

cards.name: Probe
cards.text:
Kicker {1}{B} (You may pay an additional {1}{B} as you cast this spell.)
Draw three cards, then discard two cards. If this spell was kicked, target player discards two cards.
cards.originalText:
Kicker {1}{B} (You may pay an additional {1}{B} as you play this spell.)
Draw three cards, then discard two cards from your hand.
If you paid the kicker cost, target player discards two cards from his or her hand.

cards.name: Prohibit
cards.text:
Kicker {2} (You may pay an additional {2} as you cast this spell.)
Counter target spell if its converted mana cost is 2 or less. If this spell was kicked, counter that spell if its converted mana cost is 4 or less instead.
cards.originalText:
Kicker {2} (You may pay an additional {2} as you play this spell.)
Counter target spell if its converted mana cost is 2 or less. If you paid the kicker cost, counter that spell if its converted mana cost is 4 or less instead.

cards.name: Psychic Battle
cards.text: Whenever a player chooses one or more targets, each player reveals the top card of their library. The player who reveals the card with the highest converted mana cost may change the target or targets. If two or more cards are tied for highest cost, the target or targets remain unchanged. Changing targets this way doesn't trigger abilities of permanents named Psychic Battle.

rulings.text: You can change all, some, or none of the targets.
You can't change the number of targets, choose an illegal target, or make something get targeted more than once.
An empty library will have no card to reveal, so a player with an empty library has no card to compare. The effect looks for the highest cost card of the cards that actually are revealed.
The converted mana cost of a split card is determined by the combined mana cost of its two halves.

cards.originalText: Whenever a player chooses one or more targets, each player reveals the top card of his or her library. The player who reveals the card with the highest converted mana cost may change the target or targets. If two or more cards are tied for highest cost, the target or targets remain unchanged.

cards.flavor: Children claim no two feathers are exactly the same color, then eagerly gather them for proof.
cards.originalText:

{1}: Rainbow Crow becomes the color of your choice until end of turn.

Blue spells you play cost {U} more to play.

cards.text:
{W}{W}, {T}: Target creature gains protection from the color of your choice until end of turn.

{W}{W}, {T}: Target creature gains protection from the color of your choice until end of turn.

cards.name: Sway of Illusion
cards.text:
Any number of target creatures become the color of your choice until end of turn.
Draw a card.
cards.flavor:
"I suggest you take a closer look."
—Tidal visionary

rulings.text: You can cast this and choose to target zero creatures and effectively just draw a card.

cards.originalText:
Any number of target creatures become the color of your choice until end of turn.
Draw a card.

cards.name: Teferi's Response
cards.text:
Counter target spell or ability an opponent controls that targets a land you control. If a permanent's ability is countered this way, destroy that permanent.
Draw two cards.

rulings.text: Remember that a spell only targets something if it is an Aura or uses the phrase "target" in its text.
If none of the targeted spell's targets is a land when Teferi's Response would resolve, Teferi's Response doesn't resolve due to having no legal targets.

cards.originalText:
Counter target spell or ability an opponent controls that targets a land you control. If a permanent's ability is countered this way, destroy that permanent.
Draw two cards.

cards.name: Temporal Distortion
cards.text:
Whenever a creature or land becomes tapped, put an hourglass counter on it.
Each permanent with an hourglass counter on it doesn't untap during its controller's untap step.
At the beginning of each player's upkeep, remove all hourglass counters from permanents that player controls.
cards.originalText:
Whenever a creature or land becomes tapped, put an hourglass counter on it.
Permanents with an hourglass counter on them don't untap during their controllers' untap steps.
At the beginning of each player's upkeep, remove all hourglass counters from permanents that player controls.

cards.name: Tidal Visionary
cards.text: {T}: Target creature becomes the color of your choice until end of turn.
cards.flavor: Beneath the waves, things appear the way merfolk want them to.
cards.originalText: {T}: Target creature becomes the color of your choice until end of turn.

cards.name: Tolarian Emissary
cards.text:
Kicker {1}{W} (You may pay an additional {1}{W} as you cast this spell.)
Flying
When Tolarian Emissary enters the battlefield, if it was kicked, destroy target enchantment.
cards.originalText:
Kicker {1}{W} (You may pay an additional {1}{W} as you play this spell.)
Flying
When Tolarian Emissary comes into play, if you paid the kicker cost, destroy target enchantment.

cards.name: Tower Drake
cards.text:
Flying

cards.flavor: Young tower drakes quickly learn to maneuver among Benalia's many spires.
cards.originalText:
Flying
{W}: Tower Drake gets +0/+1 until end of turn.

cards.name: Traveler's Cloak
cards.text:
Enchant creature
As Traveler's Cloak enters the battlefield, choose a land type.
When Traveler's Cloak enters the battlefield, draw a card.
Enchanted creature has landwalk of the chosen type. (It can't be blocked as long as defending player controls a land of that type.)

rulings.text: Can affect basic or non-basic types, but it must be for a specific type. The chosen type must be an existing land type. See the glossary of the comprehensive rulebook for more details on existing land types.

cards.originalText:
As Traveler's Cloak comes into play, choose a land type.
Enchanted creature has landwalk of the chosen type. (It's unblockable as long as defending player controls a land of that type.)
When Traveler's Cloak comes into play, draw a card.

cards.name: Vodalian Hypnotist
cards.text: {2}{B}, {T}: Target player discards a card. Activate this ability only any time you could cast a sorcery.
cards.flavor: "Deceit is the heart of war."
cards.originalText: {2}{B}, {T}: Target player discards a card from his or her hand. Play this ability only any time you could play a sorcery.

cards.text: When Vodalian Merchant enters the battlefield, draw a card, then discard a card.
cards.flavor: Not choosing sides in a war can be dangerous—but lucrative.
cards.originalText: When Vodalian Merchant comes into play, draw a card, then discard a card from your hand.

cards.name: Vodalian Serpent
cards.text:
Kicker {2} (You may pay an additional {2} as you cast this spell.)
Vodalian Serpent can't attack unless defending player controls an Island.
If Vodalian Serpent was kicked, it enters the battlefield with four +1/+1 counters on it.
cards.originalText:
Kicker {2} (You may pay an additional {2} as you play this spell.)
Vodalian Serpent can't attack unless defending player controls an island.
If you paid the kicker cost, Vodalian Serpent comes into play with four +1/+1 counters on it.

cards.name: Wash Out
cards.text: Return all permanents of the color of your choice to their owners' hands.
cards.flavor:
"Rest now. You've neither won nor lost, but this battle is over for you just the same."
—Teferi
cards.originalText: Return all permanents of the color of your choice to their owners' hands.

cards.name: Well-Laid Plans
cards.text: Prevent all damage that would be dealt to a creature by another creature if they share a color.
cards.flavor: "I knew this day would come," said Urza. Looking at the destruction, Barrin sighed, "You don't have to revel in it."
cards.originalText: Prevent all damage that would be dealt to a creature by another creature if they share a color.

cards.name: Worldly Counsel
cards.text: Domain — Look at the top X cards of your library, where X is the number of basic land types among lands you control. Put one of those cards into your hand and the rest on the bottom of your library in any order.

rulings.text: You choose the order on the bottom of your library.

To determine the number of basic land types among lands you control, look at the lands you have on the battlefield and ask yourself whether the subtypes Plains, Island, Swamp, Mountain, and Forest appear within that group. The number of times you say yes (topping out at five) tells you how powerful your domain abilities will be.

How many lands you control of a particular basic land type is irrelevant to a domain ability, as long as that number is greater than zero. As far as domain is concerned, ten Forests is the same as one Forest.

A number of nonbasic lands have basic land types. Domain abilities don't count the number of lands you control — they count the number of basic land types among lands you control, even if that means checking the same land twice. For example, if you control a Tundra, an Overgrown Tomb, and a Madblind Mountain, you'll have a Plains, Island, Swamp, Mountain, and Forest among the lands you control. Your domain abilities will be maxed out.

cards.originalText: Look at the top X cards of your library, where X is the number of basic land types among lands you control. Put one of those cards into your hand and the rest on the bottom of your library.

cards.name: Zanam Djinn
cards.text:
Flying
Zanam Djinn gets -2/-2 as long as blue is the most common color among all permanents or is tied for most common.
cards.originalText:
Flying
Zanam Djinn gets -2/-2 as long as blue is the most common color among all permanents or is tied for most common.

cards.name: Addle
cards.text: Choose a color. Target player reveals their hand and you choose a card of that color from it. That player discards that card.
cards.flavor:
"I'll wring out your tiny mind like a sponge."
—Urborg witch
cards.originalText: Choose a color. Look at target player's hand and choose a card of that color from it. That player discards that card.

cards.name: Agonizing Demise
cards.text:
Kicker {1}{R} (You may pay an additional {1}{R} as you cast this spell.)
Destroy target nonblack creature. It can't be regenerated. If this spell was kicked, Agonizing Demise deals damage equal to that creature's power to the creature's controller.
cards.originalText:
Kicker {1}{R} (You may pay an additional {1}{R} as you play this spell.)
Destroy target nonblack creature. It can't be regenerated. If you paid the kicker cost, Agonizing Demise deals damage equal to that creature's power to the creature's controller.

cards.name: Andradite Leech
cards.text:
Black spells you cast cost {B} more to cast.

cards.flavor:
"Older specimens are completely encrusted with gems, which serve as both armor and weapons."
—Tolarian research notes
cards.originalText:

cards.name: Annihilate
cards.text:
Destroy target nonblack creature. It can't be regenerated.
Draw a card.
cards.flavor:
"Whatever Yawgmoth marks, dies. There is no escape."
—Tsabo Tavoc, Phyrexian general

rulings.text: If the targeted creature is an illegal target when Annihilate tries to resolve, the entire spell doesn't resolve. You won't draw a card.

cards.originalText:
Destroy target nonblack creature. It can't be regenerated.
Draw a card.

cards.name: Bog Initiate
cards.flavor:
"Urborg's magic is strong. Did Urza send you to protect us or to protect against us?"
—Urborg witch, to Barrin
cards.originalText: {1}: Add {B} to your mana pool.

cards.name: Cremate
cards.text:
Exile target card from a graveyard.
Draw a card.
cards.flavor: Death's embrace need not be cold.

rulings.text: You must be able to target a card in a graveyard to cast Cremate.
If the target card is no longer in the graveyard when Cremate tries to resolve, it won't resolve and none of its effects will happen. You won't draw a card.

cards.originalText:
Remove target card in a graveyard from the game.
Draw a card.

cards.name: Crypt Angel
cards.text:
Flying, protection from white
When Crypt Angel enters the battlefield, return target blue or red creature card from your graveyard to your hand.
cards.flavor: Once an angel, now an abomination.
cards.originalText:
Flying, protection from white
When Crypt Angel comes into play, return target blue or red creature card from your graveyard to your hand.

cards.name: Cursed Flesh
cards.text:
Enchant creature
Enchanted creature gets -1/-1 and has fear. (It can't be blocked except by artifact creatures and/or black creatures.)
cards.flavor: Misery, filth, disease—all things that bring suffering to the world—only make Phyrexians more dangerous.
cards.originalText: Enchanted creature gets -1/-1 and can't be blocked except by artifact creatures and/or black creatures.

cards.name: Defiling Tears
cards.text: Until end of turn, target creature becomes black, gets +1/-1, and gains "{B}: Regenerate this creature."

cards.name: Duskwalker
cards.text:
Kicker {3}{B} (You may pay an additional {3}{B} as you cast this spell.)
If Duskwalker was kicked, it enters the battlefield with two +1/+1 counters on it and with fear. (It can't be blocked except by artifact creatures and/or black creatures.)
cards.originalText:
Kicker {3}{B} (You may pay an additional {3}{B} as you play this spell.)
If you paid the kicker cost, Duskwalker comes into play with two +1/+1 counters on it and has "Duskwalker can't be blocked except by artifact creatures and/or black creatures."

cards.name: Exotic Curse
cards.text:
Enchant creature
Domain — Enchanted creature gets -1/-1 for each basic land type among lands you control.
cards.flavor:
Fouler than a necromancer's kiss.
—Jamuraan expression

rulings.text: To determine the number of basic land types among lands you control, look at the lands you have on the battlefield and ask yourself whether the subtypes Plains, Island, Swamp, Mountain, and Forest appear within that group. The number of times you say yes (topping out at five) tells you how powerful your domain abilities will be.

How many lands you control of a particular basic land type is irrelevant to a domain ability, as long as that number is greater than zero. As far as domain is concerned, ten Forests is the same as one Forest.

A number of nonbasic lands have basic land types. Domain abilities don't count the number of lands you control — they count the number of basic land types among lands you control, even if that means checking the same land twice. For example, if you control a Tundra, an Overgrown Tomb, and a Madblind Mountain, you'll have a Plains, Island, Swamp, Mountain, and Forest among the lands you control. Your domain abilities will be maxed out.

cards.originalText: Enchanted creature gets -1/-1 for each basic land type among lands you control.

cards.text: {R}: Firescreamer gets +1/+0 until end of turn.
cards.flavor: In the dark, it's nearly invisible—until it exhales.

cards.name: Phyrexian Delver
cards.text: When Phyrexian Delver enters the battlefield, return target creature card from your graveyard to the battlefield. You lose life equal to that card's converted mana cost.
cards.originalText: When Phyrexian Delver comes into play, return target creature card from your graveyard to play. You lose life equal to that card's converted mana cost.

cards.name: Phyrexian Infiltrator
cards.text: {2}{U}{U}: Exchange control of Phyrexian Infiltrator and target creature. (This effect lasts indefinitely.)
cards.flavor:
"It is Yawgmoth's will incarnate: an efficient machine that replaces inefficient flesh."
—Tsabo Tavoc

rulings.text: It is possible to activate this ability in response to itself and generate some odd combinations. For example, if you control this card and another creature, you can use this card's ability and target the creature you control. You can then use this card's ability again and target a creature your opponent controls. The second usage resolves first and you get your opponent's creature in exchange for this one. The first usage then resolves and swaps your other creature for the Infiltrator so you get it back. The net effect is that you can swap any creature you have for any of theirs if you can pay this ability twice. Note that your opponent does get the chance to use the Infiltrator if they have the mana in between your two usages and can mess you up.
There is no effect if the same player controls both creatures when it resolves.

cards.originalText: {2}{U}{U}: Exchange control of Phyrexian Infiltrator and target creature.

cards.name: Soul Burn
cards.text:
Spend only black and/or red mana on X.
Soul Burn deals X damage to any target. You gain life equal to the damage dealt, but not more than the amount of {B} spent on X, the player's life total before the damage was dealt, the planeswalker's loyalty before the damage was dealt, or the creature's toughness.

rulings.text: Will give 1 life for each black mana used, but not more life than the amount of unprevented damage that is dealt.

cards.originalText:
Spend only black and/or red mana on X.
Soul Burn deals X damage to target creature or player. You gain life equal to the damage dealt, but not more than the amount of {B} spent on X, the player's life total before Soul Burn dealt damage, or the creature's toughness.

cards.name: Twilight's Call
cards.text:
You may cast Twilight's Call as though it had flash if you pay {2} more to cast it. (You may cast it any time you could cast an instant.)
Each player returns all creature cards from their graveyard to the battlefield.
cards.flavor:
Twilight falls. We rise.
—Necropolis inscription

rulings.text: All the creature cards enter the battlefield simultaneously.

For purposes of ordering any continuous effects of the creatures, the current player (not the controller of this spell) decides the ordering regardless of which player is putting the creatures onto the battlefield.

cards.originalText:
You may play Twilight's Call any time you could play an instant if you pay {2} more to play it.
Each player returns all creature cards from his or her graveyard to play.

cards.name: Yawgmoth's Agenda
cards.text:
You can't cast more than one spell each turn.
You may play cards from your graveyard.
If a card would be put into your graveyard from anywhere, exile it instead.

rulings.text: The cards in your graveyard are not considered to be in your hand for any reason. For example, you can't discard them.
You count spells that were cast this turn before this card enters the battlefield. (The Invasion FAQ is not correct on this point.)
It will exile itself if it is going to the graveyard from the battlefield.

cards.originalText:
Play no more than one spell each turn.
You may play cards in your graveyard as though they were in your hand.
If a card would be put into your graveyard from anywhere, remove it from the game instead.

cards.name: Ancient Kavu
cards.text: {2}: Ancient Kavu becomes colorless until end of turn.
cards.flavor: Those with the ability to change their nature survived Phyrexia's biological attacks. Everything else died.

rulings.text: Making a permanent colorless does not make it into an artifact.

cards.originalText: {2}: Ancient Kavu becomes colorless until end of turn.

cards.name: Bend or Break
cards.text: Each player separates all nontoken lands they control into two piles. For each player, one of their piles is chosen by one of their opponents of their choice. Destroy all lands in the chosen piles. Tap all lands in the other piles.
cards.originalText: Each player separates all land cards he or she controls into two face-up piles. For each player, an opponent chooses a pile. Destroy all lands in that pile. Tap all lands in the other pile.
